de.bioforscher.singa.structure.model.interfaces

Interface Atom

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MmtfAtom, OakAtom

    public interface Atom
    An Atom is the physical instance of an atom in three dimensional space.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.lang.String flatToString()
      Returns the flat String representation of this atom in the form:

    • Method Detail

      • getAtomIdentifier

        java.lang.Integer getAtomIdentifier()
        Returns the atom identifier, an integer greater or equal to 1. The identifier of the atom is not unique. Depending on the structure format you are reading there might be different atom identifiers for the same pdb structure. This means, if you have parse the pdb file of a pdb structure or the mmtf file of the same structure, you cannot rely on the identity of atoms in both structures.
        Returns:
        The atom identifier.

      • getPosition

        Vector3D getPosition()
        Returns the position in three dimensional space.
        Returns:
        The position.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(Vector3D position)
        Sets the position in three dimensional space.
        Parameters:
        position - The position.

      • getElement

        Element getElement()
        Returns the Element.
        Returns:
        The Element.

      • getAtomName

        java.lang.String getAtomName()
        Returns a short atom name. For example "CA" for C-alpha atoms in amino acids. The atom names might not be universally the same. Atoms with the name "OP2" might be called "O2P" in other structures.
        Returns:
        A short atom name.

      • getCopy

        Atom getCopy()

      • flatToString

        default java.lang.String flatToString()
        Returns the flat String representation of this atom in the form: 
             [AtomIdentifier]: [AtomName] ([xCoordinate], [yCoordinate], [zCoordinate])
        For example: 
             5444: CA (70.31099700927734, 35.60300064086914, -10.967000007629395)
     412: N2 (62.20399856567383, -8.505999565124512, 22.573999404907227)
        Returns:
        The flat String representation of this atom.
